pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:0.2_0: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:0.3_0: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:0.5_0: The training rule on large dwellings
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:1.10_0: “How can Venerable Channa have a finished dwelling roofed and plastered again and again, so that it collapsed from overloading?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:1.11_0: After rebuking Venerable Channa in many ways, they told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned Channa:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:1.12_0: “Is it true, Channa, that you did this?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:1.15_0: “... Foolish man, how can you have a finished dwelling roofed and plastered again and again, so that it collapses from overloading?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:1.16_0: Foolish man, this won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:1.17_0: the Buddha said, “And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:1.18.1_0: ‘When a monk is building a large dwelling, then standing where there are no cultivated plants, he may apply two or three courses of roofing material, taking it as far as the doorcase and using it for fixing the door and for treating the window openings.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:1.18.1_1: If he applies more than that, even if he stands where there are no cultivated plants, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:1.1_0: At one time the Buddha was staying at Kosambi, in Ghosita’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:1.2_0: At that time a government official who was Venerable Channa’s supporter was making him a dwelling.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:1.3_0: When the dwelling was finished, Channa had it roofed and plastered again and again.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:1.5_0: Then Channa dumped his grass and sticks, and he burned a certain brahmin by a fire.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:1.6_0: The brahmin complained and criticized them,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:1.7_0: “How can the venerables spoil my barley field?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:1.8_0: The monks heard the criticism of that brahmin.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:1.9_0: The monks of few desires complained and criticized her,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:2.1.10_0: for the fixing of the door.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:2.1.12_0: for treating the window openings there is white color, black color, and treating with red ocher; making a garland pattern, a creeper pattern, a shark-teeth pattern, and the fivefold pattern.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:2.1.13_0: Standing where there are no cultivated plants, he may apply two or three courses of roofing material:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:2.1.15_0: if he applies it while standing where there are cultivated plants, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:2.1.16_0: For someone covering in lines, after covering with two layers, he may ask for a third layer, and he should then depart.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:2.1.17_0: For someone covering in circles, after covering with two layers, he may ask for a third layer, and he should then depart.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:2.1.18_0: If he applies more than that, even if he stands where there are no cultivated plants:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:2.1.19_0: if he is covering with bricks, then for every brick, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:2.1.20_0: If he is covering with slate, then for every piece of slate, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:2.1.21_0: If he is covering with plaster, then for every lump, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:2.1.22_0: If he is covering with grass, then for every handful, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:2.1.23_0: If he is covering with leaves, then for every leaf, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:2.1.2_0: one with an owner is what is meant.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:2.1.4_0: One who is claspeded, stained with bath powder,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:2.1.6_0: is building or is having built.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:2.1.8_0: a distance of an arm’s reach next to the door frame.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:2.2.1_0: If it is more than two or three courses, and he perceives it as more, and he applies it, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:2.2.2_0: If it is more than two or three courses, but he is unsure of it, and he applies it, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:2.2.3_0: If it is more than two or three courses, but he perceives it as less, and he applies it, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:2.2.4_0: If it is less than two or three courses, but he perceives it as more, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:2.2.5_0: If it is less than two or three courses, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:2.2.6_0: If it is less than two or three courses, and he perceives it as less, there is no offense.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:2.3.12_0: The ninth rule, the training rule on large dwellings, is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:2.3.3_0: if he applies less than two or three courses;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:2.3.6_0: if it is a grass hut;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:2.3.7_0: if he asks for the benefit of someone else;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:2.3.8_0: if it is by means of one’s own property;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:2.3.9_0: if it is anything apart from a dwelling;
